text: Wikan Satriati (23 June 1975 â€“ 25 April 2021) was an Indonesian children's book author. She was a publishing manager at the Lontar Foundation. == Life == She graduated from Gadjah Mada University. She worked in publishing at the Lontar foundation. As a translator, Wikan translated Harry Aveling's classic study of Indonesian poetry, Secrets Need Words, Indonesian Poetry, 1966-1998 (2001). She also actively wrote children's books. Among her works are Stepping with Bismillah (2006), Ahmad and his Little Sheep (2016), and the Good Habits and Character Building series (2018). Wikan died in his hometown of Magelang on April 25, 2021 due to complications from coronavirus. == References == Category:1975 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Indonesian writers Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Indonesia
title: Wikan Satriati
